name: Regular Dodecahedron
description: some gems have qualities beyond their luster. The dodecahedron is one of those gems
specification: The dodecahedron is any polyhedron with twelve flat faces. The convex regular dodecahedron is one of the five regular Platonic solids.

name: Zonohedron
description: some gems have qualities beyond their luster. The zonohedron is one of those gems
specification: A zonohedron is a convex polyhedron where every face is a polygon with point symmetry or, equivalently, symmetry under rotations through 180 degrees

name: Hexagonal Prism
description: some gems have qualities beyond their luster. The hexagonal prism is one of those gems
specification: The hexagonal prism is a prism with hexagonal base. This polyhedron has 8 faces, 18 edges, and 12 vertices.

name: Stellated Dodecahedron
description: some gems have qualities beyond their luster. The stellated is one of those gems
specification: The small stellated dodecahedron is a Kepler-Poinsot polyhedron, named by Arthur Cayley. It is one of four nonconvex regular polyhedra. It is composed of 12 pentagrammic faces, with five pentagrams meeting at each vertex

name: Triacontahedron
description: some gems have qualities beyond their luster. The triacontahedron is one of those gems
specification: The rhombic triacontahedron, sometimes simply called the triacontahedron as it is the most common thirty-faced polyhedron, is a convex polyhedron with 30 rhombic faces. It has 60 edges and 32 vertices of two types.
